member.name: T:DotImaging.PathExtensions
member.summary: Defined functions can be used as object extensions. Provides methods for string which is treated as file and directory path.

member.name: M:DotImaging.PathExtensions.EnumerateFiles(System.IO.DirectoryInfo,System.String[],System.IO.SearchOption)
member.summary: Returns an enumerable collection of file information that matches a specified search pattern and search subdirectory option.
member.param: One of the enumeration values that specifies whether the search operation should include only the current directory or all subdirectories. The default value is .
member.returns: An enumerable collection of files that matches and .

member.name: M:DotImaging.PathExtensions.IsSubfolder(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Gets whether the path is child path.
member.returns: True if the child path is indeed child path (or the same) as parent path, otherwise false.

member.name: M:DotImaging.PathExtensions.GetRelativeFilePath(System.String,System.IO.DirectoryInfo)
member.summary: Gets relative file path regarding specified directory.
member.param: Directory info of a directory path which serves as root.
member.returns: Relative file path. In case the relative path could not be find the empty string is returned.

member.name: M:DotImaging.PathExtensions.NormalizePathDelimiters(System.String)
member.summary: Replaces path delimiters with platform-specific one defined in .

member.name: M:DotImaging.PathExtensions.NormalizePathDelimiters(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Replaces path delimiters with specified one.

member.name: M:DotImaging.PathExtensions.IsDirectory(System.String)
member.summary: Checks whether the path is file or directory.
member.returns: True if the path is directory, false if the path is file. Null is returned if the path does not exist or in case of an internal error.

member.name: T:DotImaging.NaturalSortComparer
member.summary: Provides functions for natural string comparison.

member.name: M:DotImaging.NaturalSortComparer.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of .
member.param: Sorts in ascending order, otherwise descending.

member.name: M:DotImaging.NaturalSortComparer.Compare(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Compares two strings.
member.returns: 0 - the same objects, -1, +1 otherwise depending whether the first string precedes the second one or not.

member.name: T:DotImaging.Platform
member.summary: Contains functions and properties for platform interoperability.

member.name: T:DotImaging.Platform.OperatingSystem
member.summary: Operating system type.

member.name: F:DotImaging.Platform.OperatingSystem.Windows
member.summary: Windows family.

member.name: F:DotImaging.Platform.OperatingSystem.Linux
member.summary: Linux family

member.name: F:DotImaging.Platform.OperatingSystem.MacOS
member.summary: MacOS family

member.name: M:DotImaging.Platform.getRunningPlatform
member.summary:
Gets operating system name.
Taken from: and modified.

member.name: P:DotImaging.Platform.RunningPlatform
member.summary: Gets operating system name.

member.name: M:DotImaging.Platform.AddDllSearchPath(System.String)
member.summary: Adds the specified directory to unmanaged library search path for functions that load unmanaged library. See attribute is also included. Internally it changes process environmental variable.
member.param: Directory where to search unmanaged libraries.

member.name: M:DotImaging.Platform.GetDefaultDllSearchPath(System.String)
member.summary:
Gets a default unmanaged library search directory. The default directory is platform specific:
Windows: /UnmanagedLibraries/Windows/x86/ or /UnmanagedLibraries/Windows/x64/
MacOS: /UnmanagedLibraries/MacOS/
Linux: /UnmanagedLibraries/Linux/
member.param: Root directory which marks the starting point (e.g. executing assembly directory).

member.name: M:DotImaging.Platform.AddDllSearchPath
member.summary:
Adds the default directory to unmanaged library search path for functions that load unmanaged library. The root directory is the current directory. The default directory is platform specific:
Windows: /UnmanagedLibraries/Windows/x86/ or /UnmanagedLibraries/Windows/x64/
MacOS: /UnmanagedLibraries/MacOS/
Linux: /UnmanagedLibraries/Linux/

member.name: M:DotImaging.Platform.GetModuleFormatString
member.summary: Gets a platform specific module format (e.g. Windows {0}.dll).

member.name: T:DotImaging.ImageStream`1
member.summary: Provides the base class for the image stream.

member.name: M:DotImaging.ImageStream`1.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of .

member.name: P:DotImaging.ImageStream`1.Length
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets the length in number of frames.

member.name: P:DotImaging.ImageStream`1.Position
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets the next frame index.

member.name: P:DotImaging.ImageStream`1.IsLiveStream
member.summary: Gets whether the stream is live stream meaning that its length is not constant. Those streams are usually not seek-able. See also: .

member.name: P:DotImaging.ImageStream`1.CanSeek
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the current stream supports seeking.

member.name: M:DotImaging.ImageStream`1.Seek(System.Int64,System.IO.SeekOrigin)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, sets the position within the current stream.
member.param: A frame index offset relative to the origin parameter.
A value of type System.IO.SeekOrigin indicating the reference point used to obtain the new position.
member.returns: The new position within the current stream.
member.exception: Seek operation is not supported by the current stream.

member.name: M:DotImaging.ImageStream`1.Dispose
member.summary:
Closes the stream and releases all resources.
Use Dispose function rather than Close function.

member.name: M:DotImaging.ImageStream`1.Open
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, opens the current stream.

member.name: M:DotImaging.ImageStream`1.Close
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, closes the current stream and releases any resources associated with the current stream. This function is internally called by .

member.name: T:DotImaging.ImageStreamWriter
member.summary: Image stream writer abstract class. See generic class also.

member.name: T:DotImaging.ImageStreamWriter`1
member.summary: Image stream writer abstract class. It is the base class for classes providing image stream reading.

member.name: M:DotImaging.ImageStreamWriter`1.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the image stream writer class.

member.name: P:DotImaging.ImageStreamWriter`1.WriteTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets a value, in milliseconds, that determines how long the writer will attempt to write before timing out.

member.name: M:DotImaging.ImageStreamWriter`1.WriteAsync(`0)
member.summary:
Creates and starts the task responsible for frame writing. If this function is called must be handled by a user itself.
By using this function writing to some streams can be accelerated.

member.name: M:DotImaging.ImageStreamWriter`1.Write(`0)
member.summary: Writes an image from the current stream and advances the position within the stream by 1 element.
member.returns: True if the operation is successfully completed, false if the writer failed to write or the has been reached.

member.name: M:DotImaging.ImageStreamWriter`1.WriteInternal(`0)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class returns an image and a status. Position is advanced.

member.name: T:DotImaging.ImageStreamWriterExtensions
member.summary: Provides extensions for an image stream writer.

member.name: M:DotImaging.ImageStreamWriterExtensions.Write``1(DotImaging.ImageStreamWriter{DotImaging.Image{``0}},``0[0:,0:])
member.summary: Writes a single image into the specified stream.
member.returns: True if the writing operation is successful, false otherwise.

member.name: T:DotImaging.ImageStreamReader
member.summary: Image stream reader abstract class. See generic class also.

member.name: T:DotImaging.ImageStreamReader`1
member.summary: Image stream writer abstract class. It is the base class for classes providing image stream reading.

member.name: M:DotImaging.ImageStreamReader`1.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the image reader class.

member.name: P:DotImaging.ImageStreamReader`1.ReadTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets a value, in milliseconds, that determines how long the stream will attempt to read before timing out.

member.name: M:DotImaging.ImageStreamReader`1.ReadAsync
member.summary:
Creates and starts the task responsible for frame reading. If this function is called must be handled by a user itself.
By using this function reading from some streams can be accelerated.

member.name: M:DotImaging.ImageStreamReader`1.Read(System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Reads an image from the current stream and advances the position within the stream by 1 element.
member.param: If a null is returned this can be due to has been reached.

member.name: M:DotImaging.ImageStreamReader`1.Read
member.summary: Reads an image from the current stream and advances the position within the stream by usually 1 element.

member.name: M:DotImaging.ImageStreamReader`1.ReadInternal(`0@)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class returns an image and a status. Position is advanced.

member.name: M:DotImaging.ImageStreamReader`1.GetEnumerator
member.summary:
Gets the enumerator for the stream.
If the stream does not support seek, an exception will be thrown during iteration.

member.name: M:DotImaging.ImageStreamReader`1.System#Collections#IEnumerable#GetEnumerator
member.summary:
Gets the enumerator for the stream.
If the stream does not support seek, an exception will be thrown during iteration.

member.name: T:DotImaging.ImageStreamReaderEnumerator`1
member.summary:
Enumerator for the image stream.
Stream must support seek operation.

member.name: M:DotImaging.ImageStreamReaderEnumerator`1.#ctor(DotImaging.ImageStreamReader{`0})
member.summary: Creates new image stream iterator.

member.name: M:DotImaging.ImageStreamReaderEnumerator`1.MoveNext
member.summary: Moves the position of the iterator by 1.
member.returns: True if the position increment is valid, false otherwise.

member.name: M:DotImaging.ImageStreamReaderEnumerator`1.Reset
member.summary: Resets the enumerator,

member.name: P:DotImaging.ImageStreamReaderEnumerator`1.Current
member.summary: Gets the current image within the stream.

member.name: P:DotImaging.ImageStreamReaderEnumerator`1.System#Collections#IEnumerator#Current
member.summary: Gets the current image within the stream.

member.name: M:DotImaging.ImageStreamReaderEnumerator`1.Dispose
member.summary: Disposes the iterator and resets the position within the stream.

member.name: T:DotImaging.ImageStreamReaderExtensions
member.summary: Provides extensions for image stream.

member.name: M:DotImaging.ImageStreamReaderExtensions.ReadAs``1(DotImaging.ImageStreamReader{DotImaging.IImage})
member.summary:
Calls read function defined by the stream and converts an returned image if necessary.
If the image can not be read (null), null is returned.
member.returns: Converted image or null if the image can not be read.

member.name: M:DotImaging.ImageStreamReaderExtensions.ReadTo``1(DotImaging.ImageStreamReader{DotImaging.IImage},``0[0:,0:]@)
member.summary:
Reads an element form the input stream and fills the specified buffer.
If the read element does not match the specified type a null value will be written.
member.param:
Buffer to write to.
The specified buffer can be null, as it is managed by the function itself.

member.summary: Releases all resources allocated by capture.

member.summary: Reads the next image in the stream and advances the position by one.

member.summary: Represents camera streamable source and provides functions and properties to access a device in a streamable way.

member.name: M:DotImaging.CameraCapture.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates capture from camera.

member.name: M:DotImaging.CameraCapture.Open
member.summary: Opens the camera stream.

member.name: P:DotImaging.CameraCapture.Brightness
member.summary:
Gets or sets the brightness of the camera.
If the property is not supported by device 0 will be returned.

member.name: P:DotImaging.CameraCapture.Contrast
member.summary:
Gets or sets the contrast of the camera.
If the property is not supported by device 0 will be returned.

member.name: P:DotImaging.CameraCapture.Exposure
member.summary:
Gets or sets the exposure of the camera.
If the property is not supported by device 0 will be returned.

member.name: P:DotImaging.CameraCapture.Gain
member.summary:
Gets or sets the gain of the camera.
If the property is not supported by device 0 will be returned.

member.name: P:DotImaging.CameraCapture.Hue
member.summary:
Gets or sets the hue of the camera.
If the property is not supported by device 0 will be returned.

member.name: P:DotImaging.CameraCapture.Saturation
member.summary:
Gets or sets the saturation of the camera.
If the property is not supported by device 0 will be returned.

member.name: P:DotImaging.CameraCapture.FrameSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the frame size of the camera.

member.name: P:DotImaging.CameraCapture.FrameRate
member.summary:
Gets or sets the frame rate of the camera.
If the property is not supported by device 0 will be returned.

member.name: T:DotImaging.FileCapture
member.summary: Represents video file streamable source and provides functions and properties to access data in a streamable way.

member.name: M:DotImaging.FileCapture.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates capture from video file.

member.name: M:DotImaging.FileCapture.Open
member.summary: Opens the video file stream.

member.name: P:DotImaging.FileCapture.Position
member.summary: Gets the current position in the stream as frame offset.

member.name: M:DotImaging.FileCapture.Seek(System.Int64,System.IO.SeekOrigin)
member.summary:
Sets the position within the current stream.
Warning: the underlying OpenCV function seeks to nearest key-frame, therefore the seek operation may not be frame-accurate.
member.param: A frame index offset relative to the origin parameter.
A value of type System.IO.SeekOrigin indicating the reference point used to obtain the new position.
member.returns: The new position within the current stream.

member.summary: Creates new video codec id from 4-character code. For example, FromName('P','I','M','1') is MPEG-1 codec, FromName('M','J','P','G') is motion-jpeg codec etc.

member.summary: Creates new video codec id from 4-character string.

member.summary: Casts video codec to an 32-bit integer.
member.returns: 32-bit integer representation of the video codec.

member.summary: Creates video codec from the 32-bit integer.

member.summary: Creates video codec from the 4-character string.

member.summary: Creates video writer structure.

member.summary: Creates an instance of .

If true searches the current directory and all subdirectories. Otherwise, only top directory is searched.

member.summary: Open the current stream. This overload does not do anything.

member.summary: Closes the current stream. This overload resets position to zero.

member.summary: Gets the codec used to encode frames.

member.summary: Gets the number of frames per second.

member.summary: Gets the frame size.

member.summary: Creates new video writer (with default codec).
member.param: Specifies the number of frames per second.
Specifies whether the image is color image (3 channels) or grayscale image (one channel).

member.name: M:DotImaging.VideoWriter.#ctor(System.String,DotImaging.Primitives2D.Size,System.Single,System.Boolean,DotImaging.VideoCodec)
member.summary: Creates new video writer.
member.param: Specifies the number of frames per second.
Specifies whether the image is color image (3 channels) or grayscale image (one channel).

member.name: M:DotImaging.VideoWriter.Open
member.summary: Opens the video file stream.

member.name: P:DotImaging.VideoWriter.Position
member.summary: Gets the current position in the stream as frame offset.

member.name: P:DotImaging.VideoWriter.Length
member.summary: Gets the current stream length which is not constant and is the same as position.

member.summary: Writes the provided image to the stream.

member.name: M:DotImaging.VideoWriter.Close
member.summary:
Closes video writer.
Use dispose method to remove any additional resources.
